project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1335].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Export issues created in a Service Desk from JIRA to csv
# Import issues back into JIRA mapping the Customer Request Type field to the one exported by JIRA

*Expected Behaviour*
JIRA imports issues successfully with the expected Customer Request Type

*Actual Behaviour*
Issues are imported but without the Customer Request Type

The following is seen in the log
{noformat}
2015-01-10 12:32:08,448 JiraTaskExectionThread-5 ERROR admin 752x2267x1 55b6dr 192.168.1.173 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [internal.customfields.origin.VpOriginManagerImpl] Invalid stored origin value Get IT help
2015-01-10 12:32:08,448 JiraTaskExectionThread-5 WARN admin 752x2267x1 55b6dr 192.168.1.173 /secure/admin/ImporterLogsPage!import.jspa [imports.importer.impl.AbstractDataImporter$1Thread[http-bio-8080-exec-5,5,main]] Cannot add value [ [Get IT help] ] to CustomField Customer Request Type in Issue null. Probably value was in incorrect format
{noformat}

*Workaround*
replace the value in the CSV with the "correct format" value from JIRA's database with the following SQL query. 
{code:SQL}SELECT distinct(stringvalue) from customfieldvalue, customfield where customfield.cfname = 'Customer Request Type'
and customfield.id = customfieldvalue.customfield
{code}

It should be all lower cases, with '-' instead of spaces and preceded by the project key and a slash.

For example, "Get IT Help" in project TST will need to be replaced as "tst/get-it-help"

The custom request type will have some random hash values, example: "tst/bc4b6686-1b4a-4f26-84d3-ecf184bafdd9". 
In this case, user wouldn't understand what is the correct request type for each string value.

To get the full list of request types + string value for each project, this query can be used:
{code}
SELECT p.pname, r."NAME" as request_type_name , (po."KEY" || '/' || r."KEY") AS request_type_key 
FROM "AO_54307E_VIEWPORT" po, "AO_54307E_VIEWPORTFORM" r, project p 
WHERE po."ID"=r."VIEWPORT_ID" AND po."PROJECT_ID"=p.id
ORDER BY p.pname
{code}
fields.summary: Can't import CSV generated from JIRA due to incorrect Customer Request Type format

fields.description:
When users send emails with attachments containing Norwegian characters (æ ø å / Æ Ø Å) to our Service Desk they are not added to the issue.

Instead we receive the following error.

Adding an attachment with theese letters using drag & drop or browsing directly in JIRA works, so im suspecting the mail handler to be the issue.

webwork.i18n.encoding is set to UTF-8.
fields.summary: Error adding attachment with non-english characters sent via email

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1331].
  {panel}

Any real service desk will respond to clients via email, phone, walk-up and the portal.

At this point, the only way to ensure that a customer can review the status of a request later, is by having agents log into the Service Desk portal, versus JIRA itself.

To fix this it seems there are 2 possible routes:

1. Allow the portal to be configurable in terms of displaying issues from more channels than just 'portal'.
2. Allow for the 'Channel' value to be edited on issues so Portal can be selected for any issue entered in a different way.
fields.summary: Allow issue reported via more channels to display in Service Desk portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1330].
  {panel}

At the moment, Customer can see his/her issue request by referring to the issue summary. There is no issue-key shown in the customer portal. 

Since issue key is the most referred information of an issue in JIRA, it's better to have the issue key to be shown in the customer portal. 
Customers may have a lot of issues in the customer portal which have similar title/issue summary. Having the issue key shown in the customer portal will ease the searching process to get the exact issue. 

!portal.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Showing Issue Key in the Customer Portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Actual Results:

After delete a Service Desk project, the *Field Configuration* and *Field Configuration Scheme* stays in JIRA, so we need to delete them manually.

Different from [JSD-475|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-475], we are able to delete the *Field Configuration and *Field Configuration Scheme*, however it should be deleted with the project in the first place.

h3. Expected Results:

Upon the removal of a Service Desk Project, the schemes created with it, if not modified should be deleted.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Spin up a new instance with JIRA Service Desk;
# Create a new project;
# Delete the project.

h3. Workaround:

You can manually remove the *Field Configuration* and *Field Configuration Scheme.*
fields.summary: Field Configuration after delete Service Desk project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1328].
  {panel}

This is a bit difficult in the navigation right now.

1. Enter a Service Desk portals page, e.g. 
https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/servicedesk/customer/portals
2. Enter a Service Desk, e.g.
3. Create a request
4. Now you want to create a request in another portal but in the same JSD

Witnessed result:
There is no one click way. You have to click on your profile or 'My requests' and then from there click on the JSD logo at the top. 

Expected result:
You can somehow navigate to JSD Home with the UI

You could use back but since you transmitted data with the browser, a lot of users might be careful with that. 

Also, why is the JSD logo only shown on these two pages mentioned above? 

Why can't I customize it like I can with JIRA, Confluence, etc?

Me want all this so bad :-) I want ziz! My precious!!!
fields.summary: Display JSD logo everywhere and make it customizable and make it link to /portals

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1327].
  {panel}

At the moment, Open/Closed requests in the Customer Portal is determined by the Resolution.

If a request has a resolution, it will be in *Closed requests*. If it doesn't have a resolution, it will be in *Open requests*. The status of request will not matter.

In certain situations, it would be better if the Open/Closed requests will look at the Status of the request, instead of the resolution.

For example, an agent will propose a resolution for the request (by setting a resolution) but will still need confirmation from the user. Only when the user agrees and transition the request to Closed should the request be considered closed and appear in *Closed requests*
fields.summary: Use Status to determine Open/Close requests

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1325].
  {panel}

Hi - Last month we applied our new Jira license, which is now capped at 2000 users instead of our previous unlimited license.

This broke our Zephyr plugin, due to a licensing error with the Zephyr plugin.  We tried to re-apply our current Zephyr plugin license, which is still valid and an unlimited license.  However, we got an error saying this is an invalid license and cannot be used and the plugin would not work.  For now we have applied a trial license of Zephyr and the plugin is working. 

This may just be a matter of renewing our purchased Zephyr license (expiring February 8th), but, our old license should work until then.

Could you please give some guidance to resolve this issue?
fields.summary: Zephyr licensing Issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1324].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
* Try to log in to a customer portal (https:<name>.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/user/login?destination=portals) via GAPPS.

h3.Expected Results:
User is logged in and is presented the Customer Portal.

h3.Actual Results:
User is logged in but is redirected to the dashboard instead.

h3.Workaround:
Log in via JIRA with username/password.

h3.Notes
User instance has a deprecated GAPPS integration. I tested on a test server with deprecated GAPPS and then reconnect it. The issue still persist even after reconnecting GAPPS to the test instance. This doesn't seems to be caused by the deprecation of GAPPS.
fields.summary: GAPPS Customer Portal Login is redirecting users to JIRA Dashboard instead of portal view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1318].
  {panel}

As quoted from the ["JIRA Service Desk Licensing"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+licensing#JIRAServiceDesklicensing-Whatlicensedousersneed]:
bq. If you have other users who help your service team resolving tickets and do not communicate with your customers directly, you can purchase JIRA user license seats for them. These users are collaborators in JIRA Service Desk.
These statements about collaborators could come up in the readers mind when they are not that familiar with JIRA Service Desk, whether the collaborators is:
# Doing the Resolve Transition, Or
# Helping resolving the ticket but not actually doing the transition.

Hence, it would be great if the quoted line could be improved with more emphasis on collaborators would not able to do the transition or to be assigned for the Requests raised, to prevent any misleading that Collaborators could do transitions. 

The emphasis on the line could be like "If you have other users who help your service team resolving tickets and do not communicate with your customers directly while not able to be assigned to the ticket and do transition, you can purchase JIRA user license seats for them."
fields.summary: Collaborator Section Documentation Improvement

fields.description:
h4. Summary:
any issue operations such as *commenting* or *resolve/reopen issue using transition button* for *Service Desk enabled projects* in *IE 11* causes the browser to hang. After refreshing the page, user can see that the operation was actually successfully done (the comment gets posted, status gets changed, etc).

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Open any issue in *Service Desk Project* (from agent's issue view page)
# Perform any operation, lets say, click on *Resolve issue* button
# Enter comment (optional)
# Click on *Resolve this issue* button
# JIRA will stay on that page, as shown below
!stop.png|thumbnail!
# Refresh the page (F5)
# The status was actually changed to *Resolved*, and the *comment* got posted

h4. Error thrown
Activating the developer tool shows 
{code}
Unableto get property 'removeChild' of undefined or null reference
File: batch.js, Line: 139, Column: 394 
{code}
as shown in the screenshot below
!js.png|thumbnail!

h4. Additional information:
Reproducible in IE 11 only
Does not happen with other version of IE and other browsers
Happen only to Service Desk Project (other projects work fine)
Tested with JIRA 6.3.10 and 6.3.11

h4. Workaround
In the developer tool (Emulation)
- Change the *Document Mode* and *User Agent String* to other version of IE (such as IE 10) as shown below
!mode.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue Operations do not work properly in IE11

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1304].
  {panel}

We would like to have to escalation functionality in the JIRA Service Desk Customer Portal. This functionality should include:

- Steps in the workflow that are transitioned to automatically when the issue is escalated.
- Allow to setup escalation resource, so the ticket can be assigned to a different Agent behind the scenes. This is transparent to the customer.
- Change the priority of the issue to one suited for escalation levels of urgency.
fields.summary: Provide functionality in Customer Portal to escalate an issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1303].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When viewing a Service Desk ticket through the Customer Portal, it is not possible to edit / update the priority of the Service Desk ticket.


h3. Environment
Server / Cloud


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a Request Type to add the 'Priority' field to your Service Desk Request form
# Create a new Service Desk ticket based on this edited Request Type
# View the Service Desk ticket


h3. Expected Results
The 'Priority' field should at minimum allow inline editing of its value


h3. Actual Results
A Service Desk Customer can only view the 'Priority' that was set originally when the ticket was opened
fields.summary: As a Service Desk Administrator, I would like to be able to give my customers the ability to edit their ticket priority

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1302].
  {panel}

h4. Problem statement: 
Not visible feedback for Required input field.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open ServiceDesk
2. Select Settings Tab
3. Under Get IT help select Edit Fields
4. Add any new field with Required - Yes
5. Go to Customer Portal on the ServiceDesk homepage and select Get IT help

h4. Current/Actual behavior:
All required fields are expected to be required with no disclaimer or pre-indicator.

h4. Expected/Suggested Behavior:
All required fields are expected to be required AND labeled with red asterisk next to the corresponding field.
Required field displays red asterisks or other interface indicator for better user experience.
fields.summary: ServiceDesk Customer Portal field: Required field displays red asterisks

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1299].
  {panel}

To my knowledge this functionality does not exist. 

I have one parent project with sub-projects underneath. The sub projects have their own releases which may align with (and be part of) the parent project ... or they might have to release mid-stream. 

I need the ability for each project to have their own versions (for Agile planning) but also be able to have the parent project versions selectable on that projects pages. 

Sub project page
*Sub project version
*Parent Project version

Essentially I am just trying to tie all sub projects into a parent project so when the parent is ready for release...we can run a search that says which stories/defects from the sub project made in to the parent release. 

I know the Multi-Project Picker Custom Field allows users to assign a project to multiple projects...but does it allow to show which version of these releases the story will be in? Or just list multiple projects?
fields.summary: Need to have multiple project versions appearing within one project

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1298].
  {panel}

Hello - im wondering if there is a any way of "tagging" service desk customer users with a unique identifier? My problem is outlined below:

1. We have a service desk that has multiple users granted access
2. These users represent different clients in our business
3. Depending on which "user" submits the ticket we need to be able to identify who it is and who needs to work on the ticket.

Is this possible?

Thanks
fields.summary: Ability to tag customer users?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1295].
  {panel}

h4. Summary
If a custom field of the text variety is created, and a default value is assigned to that text field, it will populate in that field through the standard JIRA UI, but not in requests created through a Service Desk portal.

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom Text Field
# Add a default value to that field
# Add the field to a screen used by a Service Desk project
# Add that field to a Service Desk request type
# Bring up the create screen for that request

h4. Expected Results
Default value will be displayed in the Customer Portal

h4. Actual Results
The field is empty, without any default value

h4. Notes
The issue seems similar to JSD-403
The fix should include for other custom field as well (date picker, number, etc.)
fields.summary: Custom text field default values do not get populated on create screens in the portal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1294].
  {panel}

Currently we don't have a way to filter out issues belonging to a particular Customer Portal in the "My Requests" page. They are showing up all together and it makes more difficult to find particular issues.

+Checklist:+
# provide option to filter issues according to Service Desks (Customer Portals)
# provide option to filter issues according to Request Types
# improve option to filter issues according to Status (in addition to Open and Closed), Priority or other fields

{panel:title=Update as of 12 Jan 2016|bgColor=#f5f5f5}
Hi everyone,

We released the ability to filter by request type, service desk and open/close on JIRA Service Desk 3.1.0-OD-10. 
Release notes for this feature can be found here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKCLOUD/2016/01/08/Improved+My+Requests+page

Cheers,
Service Desk Team
{panel}
fields.summary: Provide option to filter out issues by Customer Portal in "My Requests" page

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA Service Desk is attaching images to Service Desk Issues which form part of the Service Desk E-mail template when users respond via E-mail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket via email as a 'customer'.
# This will send an email to nominated agents about the new ticket creation.
# As one of the nominated agents, respond to email that you have just received.

h3. Expected Results
Comments/Responses should be added without anything else but the text. Template Image content should not be attached to the issue.

h3. Actual Results
Extra images (Issue type icon, company logo,comment icon) are attached along with the comment
This occurs for every comment sent.
fields.summary: Unwanted Template Images attached to Service Desk Issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Show original field name in Customer Portal's "Visible Fields"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1290].
  {panel}

hi,

We are using JSD for our IT support,
3 steps in the process :
1. our "level 1" team receives and qualifies the issues : check if they have enough information, resolve directly the easiest issues, or send them to the relevant level 2 team.
2. Our level 2 teams act on the issues and then push them "resolved".
3. The level 1 double check and close the issues

We would like to know on each issue :
- Who qualified the issue
- Who resolved the issue
- Who closed the issue

I was thinking about 3 custom fields, that would be filled during workflow transition with the current user name. But I did not found how to do that using a postfunction.
Or maybe there is a plugin who could dig in each issue history to create some kind of report or dashboard ?

How would you recommand to do that ?
fields.summary: knowing all the contributors on an issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1289].
  {panel}

We identified a bug when creating a group with two words for a request type, it creates a two separate groups instead of a single group with two words.

However, looks like if you press enter right after inserting the group name with two words it creates the single group correctly. Alternatively; you can also click the drop down and click the *'(new group)'* option to add the group in.

In order to avoid customer friction, please, review the documentations regarding the Customer Portal customisations: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Organizing+your+Customer+Portal

So the customers will be aware about how to create a group with two words.
fields.summary: Review Customer Portal documentations.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When editing the "Group" field of a Request Type and then adding a group with two words, it creates two groups instead of a group with two words separated by a space.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a Service Desk.
# Browse to the tab *Settings*.
# Click on the Groups of any Request Type.
# Edit the groups, and add a group with two words eg: "atlassian test"
# Click anywhere out of the "Group" field, it will create two groups instead of one group separated by space.

h3. Expected Results

A group with two words is created.
fields.summary: When trying to create a Group with two words in the Customer Portal, it creates two groups.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1287].
  {panel}

Register IMAP handler with some mail providers may throw "NoSuchPaddingException"
{code}
DEBUG: trying to connect to host "kkl1sexc01", port 143, isSSL false
OK The Microsoft Exchange IMAP4 service is ready.
A0 CAPABILITY
CAPABILITY IMAP4 IMAP4rev1 AUTH=NTLM AUTH=GSSAPI LOGINDISABLED STARTTLS UIDPLUS CHILDREN IDLE NAMESPACE LITERAL+
A0 OK CAPABILITY completed.
DEBUG IMAP: AUTH: NTLM
DEBUG IMAP: AUTH: GSSAPI
DEBUG: protocolConnect login, host=kkl1sexc01, user=support.it@kkl-luzern.ch, password=<non-null>
2014-12-15 15:00:15,501 http-bio-8080-exec-1 ERROR ext-niko 900x1522x1 14ydfe7 10.0.13.251,10.0.141.35 /rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/SUP/incomingemail/validateemailforcreation [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: javax/crypto/NoSuchPaddingException
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/crypto/NoSuchPaddingException
at com.sun.mail.imap.protocol.IMAPProtocol.authntlm(IMAPProtocol.java:618)
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore.login(IMAPStore.java:726)
at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPStore.protocolConnect(IMAPStore.java:648)
at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:295)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.squalor.email.MailServerVerifier.verifyMailServer(MailServerVerifier.java:38)
at com.atlassian.servicedesk.internal.email.SDMailServerManagerImpl.verifyIncomingMailServerConnection(SDMailServerManagerImpl.java:136)
{code}

*Temporary Workaround*:
Based from customer, using Secure POP rather than IMAP able to make JIRA Service Desk Mail Handler working properly.
fields.summary: Configuring imap mail handler on Service Desk throws "NoSuchPaddingException" for some mail providers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1285].
  {panel}

Hi - you've introduced a new field onto all Service Desk, giving the Customers the ability to log a ticket on behalf of someone else - "Raise this request on behalf of" ...
This was needed and I applaud that you've created it and deployed it - but I have had to create a field in the meantime to fulfill this role - "Call Originator". This is inbuilt into my dashboards and MI work for the company, to monitor who is raising calls on behalf of other people.
I have checked and I cannot add your new field to any of my Issue filters or dashboard views, so instead I need this field to be removable from my Customer Portal pages as I my customers to use the "Call Originator" field instead. But guess what - you've hardcoded it onto the page so I cannot remove it.
HELP! Can you please show how I can remove this asap as I am suddenly getting people complain about duplicate fields, not using the field I need for MI purposes and generally not happy about the Portal. This is damaging MONTHS of work to get this into my company and get people using it.
fields.summary: New field on Service Desk - I cannot hide it!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1278].
  {panel}

SD has a feature where issues are auto-transitioned from 'Waiting for Customer' to 'Waiting for Support', if a customer comments the issue and from 'Waiting for Support' to 'Waiting for Customer' if the assignee (I think) comments it.

There are requirements for that to work, like properties in the workflow. Setting this up is not a trivial task. Even so, there is no documentation about this in [JIRA Service Desk Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/JIRA+Service+Desk+Documentation].

As a customer, I would like to have this documentation, so I could modify my workflows accordingly, be able to customize them without fear of breaking this feature and be able to find problems related to it.

Also, the documentation should include that this transition does not work if the issue is created in JIRA as opposed to Customer Portal.
fields.summary: Add documentation for 'auto-transitioning issues'

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1269].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
There is no feature to bulk edit the "Request Participants" of a JIRA Service Desk Issue. Instead, when users attempt to edit the field using Bulk Edit, they experience an error stating "Bulk editing is not supported for Service Desk Request participants.". When users need to change the "Request participants" of multiple issues, they need to do it manually one by one. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for some Service Desk Issues
# Attempt to use the Bulk Edit > Edit feature
# Observe that there is no way to update the "Request Participants" as it is listed as an "Unavailable Action"

h3. Expected Results
The ability to update the "Request Participants" field should be possible.

h3. Actual Results
No such functionality exists in the product.

h3. Workarounds
A possible workaround could be to use the REST API, or SQL directly on the JIRA Database. Note that Atlassian does not support customers performing direct data manipulation of application databases via queries such as INSERT, UPDATE or DELETE, as they can easily lead to data integrity problems. If Atlassian encounters manipulation or customisations at this level, we may ask customers to restore data from their last known working state, or to engage an Expert to help recover their instance to a supportable state. If you are confident your UPDATE or INSERT is safe and your change management system is reliable, refer to the specific product's database documentation.
fields.summary: Allow to bulk change "Request participants"

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
Setup a project using Service Desk
Connect JIRA to any commit providing applciation (Fisheye,Bitbucket,...)
Access an issue with a commit logged into JIRA with a Developer

*Expected results*
Developer user should be able to see the commits associated to the issue based on the project's permission scheme (View Development Tools)

*Actual results*
Developer can't see issue's Development Panel
Permission helper states the following
{quote}
User does not have the 'View Development Tools' permission

JIRA Service Desk has overridden this permission
You are trying to perform an agent action on a service desk project. To perform this action, you must have a Service Desk agent license and both Browse and Edit Issue permissions on this project.
{quote}

Even setting the Project's Permission scheme back to the Default Permission scheme, Service Desk keeps preventing the user from seeing the development Panel
fields.summary: Service Desk doesn't allow non-agents to view Development Panel

fields.description:
Service Desk displays:

This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected.

When I look at the details I got:

The Bug - Detailed request form contains configuration errors
The following hidden fields on the request type do not have the required preset value:
Customer Request Type
To repair this request type, set a value for these fields at the fields page.

Clicking on the fields link bring me to the field form. At the bottom of the field form I have in the section: Hidden fields with preset values

This field type cannot be shown - you must provide a preset value

I try to move the field to the visible section but I cannot. Edit the value bring a popup dialog to set a preset value but I cannot preset any value with the dialog.
fields.summary: Cannot fix Service Desk complain "... the request type do not have the required preset value...

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1258].
  {panel}

I followed below "Managing customers"-instructions to create a new customer. I didn't use the "invite customer" part, instead I created the user manually (without JIRA licence) via user management.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+customers

Steps:
1) create a new user (without JIRA licence)
2) open the service desk project administration
3) open roles-section
4) add user to "Service Desk Customers"-role

After this, user can access Service Desk via Customer Portal. However, the user does not show up as "service desk customer" in user management. The acronym "SD" is missing behind the user and also when filtering by type "service desk customers" and "users", the user shows up only in the latter one.
fields.summary: New customer does not have the "service desk customer" type in user management

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1256].
  {panel}

h3. Current Behavior
In a JIRA Service Desk project the "Delete Issues" permission includes the following 
* Project Role (Administrators)
* Project Role (Service Desk Team)
* Service Desk Customer - Portal Access

Removing these permissions causes JIRA Service Desk to present an error saying there is a problem with the permission scheme that needs to be corrected.

h3. Suggested Change
Make it so that changes to the "Delete Issues" permission do not cause a JIRA Service Desk permission scheme error. 

h3. Example Use Case
As an administrator, I don't want agents being able to delete tickets - it creates a hole in the ticket ID sequence and if that ticket/request has involved multiple agents then it's very confusing.

I have changed the default permission scheme so that only administrators can delete issues,  but now I'm getting a 'Permission scheme error'.

I'm choosing to ignore it, but I'd MUCH prefer if it wasn't there
fields.summary: Restricting 'Delete' permission should NOT count as a permission scheme error

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1253].
  {panel}

Usecase:
When there is a service failure (whatever a service is) a lot of (sometimes up to hundreds) of users create a request that the particular service does not work.
This results in big amount of tickets which all have the same cause.

Problem:
There is no easy (bulk changing, linking via the link-search dialog is just to much clicks) way to 
a) hide all these tickets
b) link all these tickets
c) process all these tickets

Expected feature:
In the queue view there is a possibility to 
- easily link all those tickets together
- hide linked tickets (and present only one representative ticket)
- process the "master" ticket and affect all the linked tickets

Suggestion:
The queue view shall allow to 
- select multiple tickets via checkboxin, drag and drop, whatever
- execution of "bundle tickets" creates a new "master" ticket with all the selected tickets linked to the master ticket
- ability to hide all tickets linked in that way in the specific queue 
- ability to execute actions on the master ticket which are reflected on the linked tickets ((at least) status transitions etc.)
fields.summary: As an agent i want to be able to bundle requests which have the same cause

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1250].
  {panel}

h3.Steps to Reproduce:
# Add a newly created user (with default application access groups on creation) to the Service Desk Customer role.
# Configure *Notification Scheme* to make sure that this new user is part of the *Issue Create* event . Alternatively can also include *Reporter* to the event.
# Create a new ticket and assign the *Reporter* role to the user (on creation). 

h3.Expected Results:
The user should receive a notification.

h3.Actual Results:
The user doesn't receive the email notification on the created issue.

h3.Workaround:
This seems to only affect Service Desk Customers specifically. If added into another role; the user will be able to receive the notification normally on issue create.
fields.summary: Issue raised in behalf of SD Customers doesn't trigger Issue Create notification

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1249].
  {panel}

h3. Summary of bug

When the 'Pause' and 'Stop' conditions of the SLA are the same (or have the same effect), then when the conditions are met, neither of them would take into effect.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Set up a Service Desk, with the Stop and Pause conditions being more or less the same :
!SLA1.png|thumbnail!
# Create an issue, and then perform the action indicated in the 'Stop' or 'Pause' conditions
# The SLA would not be updated (and still running) :
!SLA2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When the Pause and Stop conditions of SLAs are the same, the action is not recognized properly

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1248].
  {panel}

-There have been two previous tickets that reported this problem as a BUG and have been closed since it is expected behaviour. Many customers feel that even though Atlassian considers this expected behaviour, it is still INCORRECT behaviour. *Please change this ticket to an SUGGESTION instead of a BUG and leave it open until the improvement has been made. We cannot use JSD until this is addressed.*-


{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
*This is an expected behaviour when Default Group Membership has been configured. See [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=677085280]*
{panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Add a Delegated LDAP directory to JIRA
# Choose the option "Copy User on Login"
# Logout from JIRA
# Access the URL of the Customer Portal of one of your Service Desks to login
# Login with a new user from LDAP (who is not in JIRA) to create the user on first login

h3. Current behaviour

The user is added to the "jira-users" group and has the permission to access JIRA and all the information from Service Desk.

h3. Expected behaviour

With the new agent-based license the user, should only be created as a "Customer" in Service Desk (specially if the option to restrict the access to the customer portal is enabled in SD).

This is not the expected behaviour because this also occurs when Service Desk is configured to restrict the access to the Customer Portal, and if the user tries to do his first login through the Custom Portal, his user has permission on all the system.
fields.summary: Creating user on first login through Customer Portal shouldn't count against the JIRA license

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h4. +Problem+
Currently installing JIRA Service Desk also installs Atlassian Chaperone. These are interdependent but disabling one won't disable the other altogether.

If an admin disables Atlassian Chaperone, accessing a Service Desk will result in an Internal Server Error (500) page with the following stacktrace:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.soy.renderer.SoyException: Unable to compile Soy templates at: com.atlassian.servicedesk:agent-view-queue
com.atlassian.soy.renderer.SoyException: Unable to compile Soy templates at: com.atlassian.servicedesk:agent-view-queue
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyManager.render(DefaultSoyManager.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.render(DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.java:52)
	at com.atlassian.soy.impl.DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.render(DefaultSoyTemplateRenderer.java:45)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:57)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:606)
...
Caused by: com.google.common.util.concurrent.UncheckedExecutionException: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Required plugin module com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-chaperone:chaperone was either missing or disabled
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$Segment.get(LocalCache.java:2234)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.get(LocalCache.java:3970)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache.getOrLoad(LocalCache.java:3974)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.get(LocalCache.java:4834)
	at com.google.common.cache.LocalCache$LocalManualCache.getUnchecked(LocalCache.java:4839)
...
{noformat}

h4. +Steps to Reproduce+
# Install JIRA Service Desk
# Create a new Service Desk
# Disable Atlassian Chaperone
# Try to access the Service Desk

h4. +Workaround+
Do not disable Atlassian Chaperone. If it is disabled, re-enabling it should make the Service Desk accessible again.

However, if the plugin is *uninstalled*, then JIRA Service Desk will be disabled and can't be re-enabled. In this case, users can only uninstall JIRA Service Desk and re-install it, which will also re-install Atlassian Chaperone.

h4. +Suggestion+
Dependent plugins of JIRA Service Desk should be made unmodifiable and rely on the status of JIRA Service Desk itself.
fields.summary: Disabling Atlassian Chaperone causes Service Desk to stop working

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
# Click on the Service Desk project > People > Customers > Invite Customers
# Enter an email address with apostrophe (john'doe@example.com)
# Click enter

h4. Expected Results
* Email is considered valid and able to continue typing next email address or send invite

h4. Actual Results
* Error message saying *john'doe@example.com is not a valid email address*
!1.png|thumbnail!
* Unable to invite customers

h4. Notes
* Tested with JIRA 6.3.11 and Service Desk 2.1.1

h4. Current workaround
# Create the user in JIRA with this email address
{{Cog icon > User Management > Users > Create User}}
# Remove the user from *jira-users* group so that he/she won't count towards the license
# Add this user to the Service Desk Customers Role
{{Projects > ServiceDeskProject > Administration > Roles}}
fields.summary: Unable to invite customers with apostophe in email (email not considered valid)

fields.description:
When you connect Service Desk to a knowledge based article, you will be able to search for articles. The search bar will first display *Find a solution*
!3.png|thumbnail!

When you change the language of JIRA (German for example), the search bar will be translated accordingly to *Finden Sie eine Losung*
!1.png|thumbnail!

However, when you click on the bar and start typing, the *Please enter 3 more characters* message remains in English 
!2.png|thumbnail!

This affects all built-in languages (French, German, Japanese, Spanish)
fields.summary: Knowledge Based Article searcher translation

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1230].
  {panel}

When a customer is invited to join Service Desk, it receives an email with a link for it to visit the portal and set its password.
However, when accessing this link using Internet Explorer 9, only a blank page is displayed.

*Steps to reproduce:*
Go to a Service Desk's People tab, then to the Customer section
Click the Invite Customers button
Add an email that you can access and click the Send Invites button
Check this email for a "Welcome to Welcome to Service Desk" email, on it there will be a Visit portal button
Open the link on this button using Internet Explorer 9

*Workaround:*
Use another browser (Firefox, Chrome, Safari), or use a newer version of Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: Unable to set password on Internet Explorer 9 when inviting customers to Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1227].
  {panel}

FYI
Check following comments I just got from one of our customers.

!^2-12-2014 15-24-37.png!


Francis
fields.summary: Comments from the field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1226].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
In JIRA Service Desk, you are able to see a list of customers from the *People* tab as described in the documentation: [Managing customers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Managing+customers]. This pages shows a dynamically updated list of up to 20 Customers. 

This feature request is to allow for the ability to show ALL customers in a single list, or alternatively, have pagination so that all Customers can be found in a list. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a Service Desk Environment with more than 20 Customers. 
# Attempt to show the complete list of customers. 

h3. Expected Results

There should be a method to show the complete list of Service Desk Customers, Functionally, this could work similar to the *User Browser* in JIRA with both:
* Pagination
* "Customers Per Page" dropdown option.

h3. Actual Results
No method to t list all customers easily exists.

h3. Notes
See the following Screenshot as an example of the current functionality.
!Screen Shot 2014-12-02 at 6.07.11 PM.png|thumbnail!

For more context on pagination, refer to the quoted text from wikipedia:

{quote}
Pagination is the process of dividing (content) into discrete pages, either electronic pages or printed pages.
{quote}
fields.summary: No Pagination for Customer List on Service Desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1225].
  {panel}

When attempting to share an issue from Service Desk View, an error appears as follows:

{noformat}
Issue Does Not Exist
The issue you are trying to view does not exist. Perhaps it has been deleted?
{noformat}

Steps to replicate:

1. As an agent, view an issue from the Service Desk queue.
2. Click on 'share' button, or press 's'

Expected result:
1. Share inline dialog opens.

Actual result:
1. Share dialog does not open.
2. Another dialog with an error message about issue not existing shows up.

Workaround:
1. View the issue in JIRA. (<instance-name>/browse/issue-key).
2. Use 'Share' feature.
fields.summary: 'Share' on Service Desk View Issue fails

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Greetings.
JSD is currently sending customer notifications in the language selected by the agent's profile instead of customer language profile settings.
Regards
fields.summary: Email language settings

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-1222].
  {panel}

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESK/Configuring+JIRA+Service+Desk+notifications#ConfiguringJIRAServiceDesknotifications-Overview

As per the above documentation, Service Desk customers receive email notifications when the following events happen:
* when they raise a request through the Customer Portal, 
* when their request is resolved, 
* when another user comments on their request, and 
* when there is a change in the request's status, i.e. the 'status name'.

Customers wont' receive any notifications when the issue is being assigned to someone. 

In some situations, it would be useful to have a notification when the issue is assigned.
fields.summary: Email notification for Issue Assigned
